greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A163659(n^2), where A163659 is the logarithmic derivative of Stern's diatomic series (A002487).
comment: Multiplicative because A163659 is. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 26 2018
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: a[n_] := Times @@ (Function[{p, e}, Which[p == 2, 2^(e+1) - 1, p == 3, -2, True, 1]] @@@ FactorInteger[n^2]);
program: (PARI) {a(n)=local(X=x+x*O(x^n), A); A=log(1+X+X^2) + sum(k=0, #binary(n), 3*2^k*log(1 + X^(2*2^k) + X^(4*2^k))); n*polcoeff(A, n)}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 20 2011
